revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Mandy Stadtmiller | image = Mandy Stadtmiller.jpg | image_size = 150px | caption = Stadtmiller at the March 19, 2009 Liam McEneaney's Writings with Music in [[Union Hall, Brooklyn]], [[Brooklyn, New York|New York]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1975|10|24}} | birth_place = [[San Diego, California]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = [[Journalist]], [[comedian]] | salary = | networth = |spouse = {{marriage|[[Pat Dixon (comedian)|Pat Dixon]]|November 2015}} | website = http://mandystadtmiller.com/ | notable_works = "Unwifeable: A Memoir" }} '''Mandy Stadtmiller''' (born October 24, 1975) is an author and columnist for ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' magazine,<ref name="nymag.com">{{cite web|title = Step One: Resolve to Die Alone. Step Two: Get Married.|url = http://nymag.com/thecut/2016/02/resolve-to-die-alone-then-get-married.html|website = The Cut|access-date = 2016-02-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title = Stella Bugbee on Twitter|url = https://twitter.com/stellabugbee/status/695274959443226624|website = Twitter|access-date = 2016-02-20}}</ref> former editor-at-large of [[xoJane]],<ref>{{cite web|url =http://www.xojane.com/page/about|title =xoJane|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20150830074623/http://www.xojane.com/page/about|archive-date =2015-08-30|url-status=dead|df =}}</ref> "Girl Talk" columnist for ''[[Penthouse (magazine)|Penthouse]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://instagram.com/p/0MJiTvBJ7d/|title=Instagram photo by Mandy Stadtmiller • Mar 14, 2015 at 1:33am UTC|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hopesandfears.com/hopes/now/pop-stuff/214107-dark-humor-comedy-roundtable|title=Too soon? Humorists weigh in on dark comedy|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> and host of the comedy podcast "News Whore." She is also known for her dating column in the ''[[New York Post]]'', called “About Last Night.” Her other ''Post''-published exploits include a visit to [[Nevada]]’s first male prostitute and a controversial [https://nypost.com/2009/10/22/cheat-sheet-9/ "Cheat Sheet"].
Her TV appearances include ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]'', ''[[Nightline]]'', ''[[20/20 (U.S. TV series)|20/20]]'', ''[[Insider (television show)|The Insider]]'', ''[[Dr. Drew On Call]]'', ''[[Jane Velez-Mitchell (TV program)|Jane Velez-Mitchell]]'', ''Uncommon Sense with Charlamagne Tha God'', ''[[Good Day New York]],'' ''[[Red Eye (TV series)|Red Eye]]'', ''[[Katie (talk show)|Katie]]'', ''[[The Artie Lange Show]]'', ''[[The Joy Behar Show]]'', ''[[Howard Stern]] TV'', ''[[Fuse TV]]'' and ''[[VH1]]''.
She has also written for ''[[The Washington Post]]'', ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]'', ''[[Mashable]]'', ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'', ''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]]'', ''[[The Village Voice]]'', ''[[South Florida Sun-Sentinel|The Fort Lauderdale Sun-Sentinel]]'', ''[[Des Moines Register|The Des Moines Register]]'', ''[[Playgirl]]'' and [[Match.com]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.match.com/magazine/article/7258/My-First-Valentines-Day-As-A-Divorcee/|title=Match.com - Find Singles with Match.com's Online Dating Personals Service|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref>
She is a contributor to [[HuffPost Live]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/archive/segment/512c2db778c90a16c00010b2 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/archive/segment/512c2de178c90a16c0001196 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/segment/dick-pic-etiquette/51f166f702a7607c5b000464 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/segment/these-are-the-boundaries-you-should-have-online/5231ef112b8c2a45010006f0 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/segment/is-that-thong-tha-thong-thong-thong-unhealthy/525d6d1502a76071490000a0 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/segment/instant-take-home-do-it-yourself-std-test/5266e28b2b8c2a121f000129 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/segment/third-metric-bad-habits/5277d7ed78c90a09890004d4 | work=Huffington Post | title=HuffPost Live}}</ref>
Stadtmiller wrote about inspiring the Nina Howard character (played by [[Hope Davis]]) in ''[[The Newsroom (U.S. TV series)|The Newsroom]]'' after briefly dating [[Aaron Sorkin]] and showed their correspondence about the development of the "Bad Mandy" character in [[xoJane]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/mandy-stadtmiller-dated-aaron-sorkin-newsroom-character-358625|title=Mandy Stadtmiller: I Dated Aaron Sorkin, Became 'Newsroom' Character Inspiration|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.xojane.com/entertainment/mandy-stadtmiller-aaron-sorkin-newsroom-character |title=Archived copy |access-date=2014-12-22 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141222120847/http://www.xojane.com/entertainment/mandy-stadtmiller-aaron-sorkin-newsroom-character |archive-date=2014-12-22 |url-status=dead |df= }}</ref>
==Early life== Stadtmiller was born in [[San Diego, California|San Diego]] in 1975 to Patricia and Jerry Stadtmiller, an ex-Marine and [[Vietnam veteran]]. In a 2018 interview, Stadtmiller stated that multiple bullet wounds to the face received during combat in Vietnam left her father completely blind and suffering anger management issues related to an acquired brain injury.<ref name="wtfpod1">{{cite web |title=Episode 910 - Mandy Stadtmiller |publisher=WTF with Marc Maron |url=https://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-910-mandy-stadtmiller |accessdate=April 15, 2019}}</ref>
She attended [[University of San Diego High School|The University of San Diego High School]] in California. In 1997, she received her bachelor's degree in journalism from [[Northwestern University]].
==Career== In August 2006, Stadtmiller was groped and bitten by actor/comedian [[Andy Dick]] during an interview following his appearance on the [[Comedy Central Roast of William Shatner]]. She wrote about the incident for [[Page Six]] of ''[[The New York Post]]''.<ref name="PAGESIX">{{cite news |url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/08152006/gossip/pagesix/pagesix.htm |title=Comic's Worst Gross-Out Ever |publisher=Nypost.com |date= August 16, 2006}}</ref> Dick claimed that Stadtmiller “slanted” the incident.<ref name="DICKTICK">{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/10/06/AR2006100600242.html |title=What Makes Andy Dick Tick? |publisher=Washingtonpost.com |date= October 8, 2006 |first=William |last=Booth}}</ref>
In 2006, Stadtmiller won first place in [[New York's Funniest Reporter Show]]<ref>{{cite web|author=Administrator |url=http://www.nyfunniestreporter.com |title=nyfunniestreporter.com |publisher=nyfunniestreporter.com |date=2011-08-02 |accessdate=2012-06-09}}</ref> contest<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nyfunniestreporter.com/2006Reporters.html |title=2006 New York's Funniest Reporters |publisher=nyfunniestreporter.com |accessdate=2010-02-19 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071027084623/http://www.nyfunniestreporter.com/2006Reporters.html |archivedate=2007-10-27 |df= }}</ref> in the New York City Underground Comedy Festival.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nyucf.com/ |title=nyucf.com |publisher=nyucf.com |date= |accessdate=2012-06-09 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120618175841/http://nyucf.com/ |archivedate=2012-06-18 |df= }}</ref> In October 2007, she became a semi-finalist in the search for New York's Funniest Stand-Up<ref>[http://ccinsider.comedycentral.com/cc_insider/2007/10/video-mandy-sta.html ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071028184202/http://ccinsider.comedycentral.com/cc_insider/2007/10/video-mandy-sta.html |date=October 28, 2007 }}</ref> a contest run by the [[New York Comedy Festival]]. She performs stand-up comedy throughout New York City at various clubs and venues.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pushcreative.tv/mandy_stadtmiller.php|title=Mandy Stadtmiller - Push Creative|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref>
In 2010, she went undercover as a client to hire the nation's first legal male prostitute, who worked at the [[Shady Lady Ranch]].<ref name="nyp">{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/entertainment/my_night_with_prosti_dude_LxwFH9NnMM0Mdo1KfHRdpK|title=My night with a prosti-dude|last=Stadtmiller |first=Mandy|date=February 2, 2010|work=New York Post|accessdate=2010-02-11}}</ref> The article received notable attention from such media outlets as ''[[The Colbert Report]]'' and ''[[The Joy Behar Show]]''.
According to her Twitter account, in February 2012 Stadtmiller quit The New York Post.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://twitter.com/mandystadt/status/166662549385920512 |title=Did I mention I quit @newyorkpost? It's true... |publisher=Twitter.com |accessdate=2012-02-06 | first=Mandy | last=Stadtmiller | date=2012-02-06}}</ref> She is a frequent contributor to the gossip pages of Page Six.
Stadtmiller is Editor-at-Large of [[Jane Pratt]]'s site [[xoJane]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.xojane.com/author/Mandy |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-01-03 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131222191149/http://www.xojane.com/author/mandy |archivedate=2013-12-22 |df= }}</ref> In September 2015, she wrote about continuing to have this role at the site but going freelance in a controversial piece called "How I Became a First-Person Human Trafficker" for ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/thecut/2015/09/happened-to-me-happened-to-me.html|title=It Happened to Me: How I Became a First-Person Human Trafficker|date=21 September 2015|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> For her work at xoJane, Stadtmiller was profiled twice in [[The New York Observer]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://observer.com/2012/09/the-mandy-show-mandy-stadtmiller-spills-on-memoir-xojane-and-a-reality-show/|title=The Mandy Show: Mandy Stadtmiller Spills On Memoir, xoJane–and a Reality Show?|date=19 September 2012|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://observer.com/2013/04/gross-encounters-of-the-mandy-stadtmiller-kind/|title=Gross Encounters of the Mandy Stadtmiller Kind|date=30 April 2013|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> as well as on [http://flavorwire.com/ Flavorwire]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://flavorwire.com/388823/in-defense-of-mandy-stadtmiller-why-internet-oversharing-isnt-just-xojanes-problem/|title=In Defense of Mandy Stadtmiller: Why Internet Oversharing Isn’t Just xoJane’s Problem|date=2 May 2013|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> and [http://therumpus.net/ The Rumpus].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://therumpus.net/2013/11/the-rumpus-interview-with-mandy-stadtmiller/|title=The Rumpus Interview with Mandy Stadtmiller|date=15 November 2013|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref>
In 2014, she was named as one of the 25 "[http://www.xojane.com/fun/xojanes-25-most-shameless-people-on-the-web most shameless people on the Web]" [https://web.archive.org/web/20140413145117/https://movies.yahoo.com/photos/xojane-com-celebrates-first-ever-20140311-072015-241.html at SXSW], where she was featured on a panel with [[Jane Pratt]], [[Kristina Wong]] and [[Issa Rae]] for "[http://schedule.sxsw.com/2014/events/event_IAP20635 Fearlessly Funny: The Women Changing Digital Humor]."
Largely known for her social media presence, Stadtmiller was the first verified Twitter user from the ''New York Post'',<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.xojane.com/tech/how-to-get-verified-on-twitter |title=Archived copy |access-date=2013-08-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130824223650/http://www.xojane.com/tech/how-to-get-verified-on-twitter |archive-date=2013-08-24 |url-status=dead |df= }}</ref> and frequently writes about using social media for networking, including how to boost one's [[Klout]] score. (Stadtmiller's Klout score is 82.)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.xojane.com/relationships/cant-find-a-job |title=Archived copy |access-date=2013-08-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130816022021/http://www.xojane.com/relationships/cant-find-a-job |archive-date=2013-08-16 |url-status=dead |df= }}</ref>
Stadtmiller currently hosts a podcast on the [[RiotCast Network]] called ''News Whore''. ''News Whore'' debuted at #22 in comedy podcasts on iTunes and has consistently remained in the top 100 since its launch in July.<ref name="xojane.com">{{Cite web |url=http://www.xojane.com/entertainment/how-to-podcast |title=Archived copy |access-date=2013-08-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130820201706/http://www.xojane.com/entertainment/how-to-podcast |archive-date=2013-08-20 |url-status=dead |df= }}</ref>
In early 2015, Stadtmiller announced "[http://mandyproject.com/ The Mandy Project]," a month-long quest to find the perfect Valentine's Day date in partnership with the online dating website [[PlentyofFish|Plenty of Fish]]. For a month, she chronicled going on a series of dates and testing out romantic cliches such as "Play hard to get," "Love like you've never been hurt" and "Everything happens for a reason." The next month she announced that she would be documenting her relationship in "real-time" in a Kindle singles series called "[https://www.amazon.com/Mandy-Stadtmiller/e/B00DD8AFN8/ref=sr_ntt_srch_lnk_5?qid=1430841754&sr=8-5 Dear TMI-ary]," <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bustle.com/articles/69973-7-rules-for-writing-about-your-new-relationship-as-it-unfolds-because-tmi-can-be-rewarding|title=7 Rules For Writing About Your New Relationship As It Unfolds, Because TMI Can Be Rewarding|first=Allison|last=McCarthy|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> where she wrote about her new relationship with [[Pat Dixon (comedian)|Pat Dixon]]. On 11 November 2015, she and Dixon married onstage in a comedy club, as part of Dixon's comedy show. Both the proposal and the wedding were broadcast on social media app [[Periscope (app)|Periscope]], and tickets could be purchased to attend the joint wedding/comedy show.
In 2016, she began the weekly "Unwifeable" column for [[New York (magazine)|New York Magazine]]'s The Cut, chronicling her unlikely and unfolding marriage to [[Pat Dixon (comedian)|Pat Dixon]] despite being in her eyes "the most unwifeable woman in New York."<ref name="nymag.com"/>

== Television appearances == * ''[[Good Day New York]]'' (2006) * ''[[Red Eye w/ Greg Gutfeld|Red Eye]]'' [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IHtJLMdZleU (2007)] * [[Fuse TV]]’s “10 Great Reasons” [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPwf-z630M8 (2007)] * [[VH1]]’s “Rock Band Cometh”<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1136621/|title=Rock Band Cometh: The Rock Band Band Story|date=11 November 2007|publisher=|accessdate=9 December 2016|via=IMDb}}</ref> (2007)<ref name="xojane.com"/> *''[[Insider (television show)|The Insider]]''[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QQYhanE4nrg (2010)] *''[[The Joy Behar Show]]''[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NlJmpBk3gWQ (2010)] *''[[Pepsi: The Flow]]'' [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5dKASNleDsM (2011)] *''[[20/20 (U.S. TV series)|20/20]]'' (2012)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.xojane.com/entertainment/how-to-prepare-for-doing-a-tv-appearance-and-hey-check-me-out-on-20-20-tonight |title=Archived copy |access-date=2014-01-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140103214936/http://www.xojane.com/entertainment/how-to-prepare-for-doing-a-tv-appearance-and-hey-check-me-out-on-20-20-tonight |archive-date=2014-01-03 |url-status=dead |df= }}</ref> *''[[Dr. Drew On Call]]'' [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8Wg-yaw3Vw (2012)] *''[https://web.archive.org/web/20140104061247/http://thelip.tv/media-mayhem/ Media Mayhem with Allison Hope Weiner]''[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EWMgCt7OKYI (2013)] *''[[Jane Velez-Mitchell (TV program)|Jane Velez-Mitchell]]'' (2013) *''[[The Artie Lange Show]]'' (2014) *''[[Katie (talk show)|Katie]]'' (2014) *''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]'' (2014) *''[[Nightline]]'' (2014) *''[[Last Week Tonight with John Oliver]]'' (2014) *''[[CNN Daily Share]]'' (2015)
== Radio show appearances == * [[Howard Stern]]’s [[Howard Stern On Demand|In Demand Channel]] (2006) * ''[[The Lazlow Show]]'' (2006) * ''[[Raw Dog Comedy]]'' (2007) * ''[[Opie and Anthony]]'' (2007, [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kbS_dIue7is 2013], 2014) * [[Maxim Radio]] (2007) * [[WOR (AM)|WOR]] (2007) * [[The Jenny Hutt Show]] (2012, 2015) * [[The Jane Pratt Show]] (2012) * [[Alan Colmes Show]] (2014, 2015) * [[My Wife Hates Me]] (2015) * [[The Jenny McCarthy Show (radio show)|The Jenny McCarthy Show]] (2015) * [[Emily McCombs "OverShare"]] (2015) * [[My Wife Hates Me]] (2016)
